channel.itunes:author: Your (optional) podcast author name
channel.itunes:summary: Bob Schieffer asks the biggest guests the smartest questions. Hear official Washington on the firing line, on your schedule.
channel.description: Bob Schieffer asks the biggest guests the smartest questions. Hear official Washington on the firing line, on your schedule.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 06/03
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer discusses Mitt Romney clinching the Republican nomination with David Axelrod and Reince Priebus. A politics panel with Former Pennsylvania Governor Ed Rendell, Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison, Michael Gerson and Bob Shrum examines why the word "moderate" has become a dirty word in American politics. Plus, new perspectives on President Obama and the War on Terror with David Sanger and Daniel Klaidman.
item.description: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer discusses Mitt Romney clinching the Republican nomination with David Axelrod and Reince Priebus. A politics panel with Former Pennsylvania Governor Ed Rendell, Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison, Michael Gerson and Bob Shrum examines why the word "moderate" has become a dirty word in American politics. Plus, new perspectives on President Obama and the War on Terror with David Sanger and Daniel Klaidman.
item.itunes:keywords: Campaign 2012, Mitt Romney, President Obama, War on Terror, Moderate
item.author: Your (optional) podcast author email address (Your (optional) podcast author name)

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 05/27
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer speaks with Robert Gibbs and Ed Gillespie about the Obama camp's attacks on Romney's record at Bain Capital. Indiana Republican Senator Richard Lugar reflects on how Congress and campaigns have changed. Plus, a roundtable discussion on the presidency with Douglas Brinkley, Nancy Gibbs, Michael Duffy and Robert Merry.
item.description: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer speaks with Robert Gibbs and Ed Gillespie about the Obama camp's attacks on Romney's record at Bain Capital. Indiana Republican Senator Richard Lugar reflects on how Congress and campaigns have changed. Plus, a roundtable discussion on the presidency with Douglas Brinkley, Nancy Gibbs, Michael Duffy and Robert Merry.
item.itunes:keywords: President Obama, Mitt Romney, Bain Capital, Campaign 2012, Indiana Republican Senator Richard Lugar

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 05/20
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer examines the debt limit with Senators Mitch McConnell, Lindsey Graham and Mark Warner. Clarissa Ward and Tom Friedman discuss foreign policy. Plus, Bob sits down with Norah O'Donnell and John Dickerson to talk politics.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 05/13
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer discusses how President Obama's comments on gay marriage may impact Campaign 2012. Plus, House Intelligence Committee Chairman Representative Mike Rogers with the latest on the terror bomb plot. And a Mother's Day roundtable discussion on women voters.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 05/06
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of "Face the Nation," CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer speaks with former House Speaker Newt Gingrich and Rep. Michele Bachmann. Plus, Senator Chuck Schumer, former Vermont Governor Howard Dean, Zbigniew Brzezinski and a politics panel talk Campaign 2012 and the Chinese dissident situation.

item.itunes:summary: On today's Face the Nation, CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer talks Campaign 2012 and the hispanic vote with former Mississippi Gov. Haley Barbour, Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa and California Gov. Jerry Brown.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 04/22
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: This week's Face the Nation looks into the USSS scandal with Sen. Lieberman and Ralph Basham. Also, Professor Cornel West and talk show host Tavis Smiley contribute to a discussion on poverty in America. Finally, there is a panel on who will be the GOP VP pick.

item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: The latest on the Secret Service Scandal with Rep. Darrell Issa (R-CA). Missles to mommy wars with Senator John McCain. Plus, a tax day interview with Treasury Secretary Tim Geithner.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 04/08
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of the Face the Nation, CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer discusses the role religion plays in politics and everyday life with New York Cardinal Timothy Dolan and recalls the life of CBS News Correspondent Mike Wallace and the impact he had on modern journalism.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 04/01
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: The Republicans may not have their nominee yet -- at least not officially -- but the general election campaign is already underway and we'll devote the next hour to it. CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer speaks with Vice President Joe Biden and Republican presidential candidates Newt Gingrich and Ron Paul on today's Face the Nation.
item.description: The Republicans may not have their nominee yet -- at least not officially -- but the general election campaign is already underway and we'll devote the next hour to it. CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer speaks with Vice President Joe Biden and Republican presidential candidates Newt Gingrich and Ron Paul on today's Face the Nation.
item.author: Your (optional) podcast author email address (Your (optional) podcast author name)

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 03/25
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: Will the Etch-a-Sketch wars influence the Louisiana Primary results? GOP presidential hopeful Rick Santorum weighs in. Plus, House Budget Chairman Paul Ryan and Senator Chuck Schumer join Norah O'Donnell to discuss the politics of Medicare and the budget battle.
item.description: Will the Etch-a-Sketch wars influence the Louisiana Primary results? GOP presidential hopeful Rick Santorum weighs in. Plus, House Budget Chairman Paul Ryan and Senator Chuck Schumer join Norah O'Donnell to discuss the politics of Medicare and the budget battle.
item.itunes:keywords: Romney, Santorum, politics, 2012, GOP, economy, budget, New York, health care, election
item.author: Your (optional) podcast author email address (Your (optional) podcast author name)

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 03/18
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: Bob Schieffer, host of Face the Nation and CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent, talks with David Axelrod, Chief Strategist for Obama's 2012 reelection campaign. Axelrod says GOP's gas price talk is "snake oil." He adds that GOP candidates are pandering to voters, making false promises about reducing pump prices. Also, Republican National Committee Chairman Reince Priebus says he is not planning for brokered convention. Bob Schieffer says the fuel pump gauge doesn't just have an impact on U.S. races. Republican strategist and Romney supporter Vin Weber explains why a brokered convention would be bad for party.
item.description: Bob Schieffer, host of Face the Nation and CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent, talks with David Axelrod, Chief Strategist for Obama's 2012 reelection campaign. Axelrod says GOP's gas price talk is "snake oil." He adds that GOP candidates are pandering to voters, making false promises about reducing pump prices. Also, Republican National Committee Chairman Reince Priebus says he is not planning for brokered convention. Bob Schieffer says the fuel pump gauge doesn't just have an impact on U.S. races. Republican strategist and Romney supporter Vin Weber explains why a brokered convention would be bad for party.
item.author: Your (optional) podcast author email address (Your (optional) podcast author name)

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 03/13
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: Republican presidential candidate Newt Gingrich this morning called for the U.S. to withdraw its troops from Afghanistan. His statement on CBS News' "Face the Nation" came as news broke this morning of a U.S. soldier opening fire and killing at least 16 Afghan civilians, including women and children, in Kandahar province. That and more with CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer.
item.description: Republican presidential candidate Newt Gingrich this morning called for the U.S. to withdraw its troops from Afghanistan. His statement on CBS News' "Face the Nation" came as news broke this morning of a U.S. soldier opening fire and killing at least 16 Afghan civilians, including women and children, in Kandahar province. That and more with CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 03/05
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: Indiana Governor Mitch Daniels has the latest on the devastating tornado damage, plus Newt Gingrich and Ron Paul on the countdown to Super Tuesday. All this and more on Face the Nation with Bob Schieffer.
item.description: Indiana Governor Mitch Daniels has the latest on the devastating tornado damage, plus Newt Gingrich and Ron Paul on the countdown to Super Tuesday. All this and more on Face the Nation with Bob Schieffer.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 02/26/12
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: Face the Nation on the Radio: 02/26/12
item.itunes:summary: New Jersey Governor Chris Christie was very blunt in his assessment of the Republican presidential nominating contest: "Rick Santorum will not be the nominee." On CBS News' "Face the Nation," the New Jersey governor told host CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer that the former Pennsylvania Senator is less appealing to a broader Republican base (as well as to independent voters) than is Mitt Romney, and that Santorum is mistakenly focused on social issues.
item.description: New Jersey Governor Chris Christie was very blunt in his assessment of the Republican presidential nominating contest: "Rick Santorum will not be the nominee." On CBS News' "Face the Nation," the New Jersey governor told host CBS News Chief Washington Correspondent Bob Schieffer that the former Pennsylvania Senator is less appealing to a broader Republican base (as well as to independent voters) than is Mitt Romney, and that Santorum is mistakenly focused on social issues.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 02/19/12
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: Bob Schieffer talks with Rick Santorum. What's behind his momentum, and can he sustain it? Also, Bob has a roundtable discussion with Karen Tumulty of The Washington Post and Todd Spangler of The Detroit Free Press.
item.description: Bob Schieffer talks with Rick Santorum. What's behind his momentum, and can he sustain it? Also, Bob has a roundtable discussion with Karen Tumulty of The Washington Post and Todd Spangler of The Detroit Free Press.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 02/12/12
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: On "Face the Nation" Senate Republican Mitch McConnell speaks on the long republican race and if it will hurt the Republican candidates chances. Bob Schieffer also speaks with Chief of Staff, Jack Lew on the latest on the war in which the President finds himself with the Catholic Church.
item.description: On "Face the Nation" Senate Republican Mitch McConnell speaks on the long republican race and if it will hurt the Republican candidates chances. item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 02/05
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: On "Face the Nation" ex-Speaker Newt Gingrich outlines his path to nomination and explains why he would back Romney as nominee after calling him a liar. Bob Schieffer also speaks with former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani and The Boston Globe's Michael Kranish, author of The Real Romney.
item.description: On "Face the Nation" ex-Speaker Newt Gingrich outlines his path to nomination and explains why he would back Romney as nominee after calling him a liar. Bob Schieffer also speaks with former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani and The Boston Globe's Michael Kranish, author of The Real Romney.
item.itunes:keywords: Face the nation, newt gingrich, gop, politics, Rudy Giuliani, The Real Romney

item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary: This Sunday on Face the Nation with Bob Schieffer, GOP presidential candidate, former House Speaker Newt Gingrich talks about the last debate, his chances of winning on Tuesday and what's next for his campaign.

item.title: Face the Nation on the Radio: 01/22
item.itunes:author: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:subtitle: CBS Radio News
item.itunes:summary:
This week on Face the Nation, Republican front runner Newt Gingrich joins Bob Schieffer.
The morning after the South Carolina primary, Bob Schieffer also talks to two key southern Republicans -- Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) and Gov. Haley Barbour (R-MI) -- about what the results will mean for the GOP moving forward.
item.description: This week on Face the Nation, Republican front runner Newt Gingrich joins Bob Schieffer. The morning after the South Carolina primary, Bob Schieffer also talks to two key southern Republicans -- Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) and Gov. Haley Barbour (R-MI) -- about what the results will mean for the GOP moving forward.
